author: Sean Gibson
title: Pogba family support Paul and Florentin with half-and-half shirts during Man Utd vs St-Etienne
text:
T he Pogba family were out in force at Old Trafford on Thursday night for Saint-Etienne's visit to Manchester United - and made sure both brothers Paul and Florentin knew they had their full support.
The Europa League tie pitted world-record transfer holder Paul Pogba against his sibling Florentin , of more modest repute. But the watching family made clear they were going to be equal in their backing by wearing half-and-half shirts and scarves.
Usually an offence for which there is little patience among football supporters, but an exception was definitely made for the Pogbas' mum, Yeo Moriba.
Fair play to Pogba's mum. The first person ever to wear and half-and-half scarf at a football match and not deserve a good hiding for it.
— Mike Holden (@Ratings_Mike) February 16, 2017 Credit: Shaun Botterill/Getty T he clashing green and red colour-schemes made the Pogba family stand out from the crowd, as United eventually ran out 3-0 winners against Saint-Étienne after a keenly contested game.
The French side threatened for long spells but their hosts came good in the final 20 minutes to establish a commanding lead ahead of next week's return leg.
Florentin had to go off injured in the final quarter-hour, but the defender was able to embrace his brother before leaving the pitch with Saint-Étienne's medical staff.
Credit: Martin Rickett/PA Wire Yeo Moriba, the mother of footballer Paul Pogba, holds his photograph Credit: FRANCK FIFE/AFP PHOTO P rior to the game, the brothers had emerged from the Old Trafford tunnel side by side, deep in conversation, with Florentin sporting a special hairstyle to mark the occasion.
Paul Pogba: every crazy haircut C ome the game, both men were well involved in a largely even contest - with Paul inches away from a goal on several occasions.
In the second half, the United midfielder first headed against the crossbar from six yards out, then curled a superb effort the wrong side of the post after pirouetting past his marker on the edge of the box.
Credit: Martin Rickett/PA F lorentin, 26, had said prior to the game that he was looking forward to the "magical moment" of his clash with his younger brother - and so were the family.
"Obviously these things don't happen very often in a player's career, the chance to see her two sons playing against each other. She can't lose really, can she?
"We've given each other some stick and there was some banter straight after the draw was made, but since then we've been so focused on our respective league games."
Paul stole the show last year at the Ballon d'Or awards ceremony, wearing a gold-flecked suit to match his hair and making his mum his plus-one.
From Mathias Pogba to Federico Higuain - playing in the shadows of their famous footballing brothers
